data.approach: Add position:sticky and top:0 with appropriate z-index to .project-tabs in /tasks3. Need to account for no TopBar in this page layout, and ensure proper background to avoid content showing through.

summary: Added position: sticky, top: 0, and z-index: 30 to .project-tabs CSS class in /tasks3 page
Project tabs now stay visible at the top when scrolling through sessions and tasks
reviewFocus: Verify sticky behavior in browser by scrolling

data.approach: Phase 2: Fix visual hierarchy - reduce prominence of child table rows by removing/hiding thead, reducing row padding/background, and making the accordion headers more visually dominant. Also ensure continuous background for accordion continuity.

summary: Made project tabs sticky with position: sticky, top: 0, z-index: 30
Fixed visual hierarchy in accordion groups by:
- Hiding thead in embedded tables (parent accordion header provides context)
- Making row separators more subtle with 50% opacity
- Applied to both TasksActive (sessions) and TasksOpen (tasks) components
Made project tabs sticky with position: sticky, top: 0, z-index: 10
Added visual hierarchy fixes for accordion content in TasksActive and TasksOpen
Hidden table headers inside accordions (parent accordion header provides context)
Removed wrapper backgrounds/borders for visual continuity
Reduced cell padding from 0.75-0.875rem to 0.5rem for compact child rows
Created /tasks4 as experimental variant without sticky expanded session rows

suggestedTasks.title: Investigate and fix dropdown clipping in accordion content
suggestedTasks.description: TaskIdBadge and other dropdown menus may be clipped by accordion overflow settings. Test on /tasks4 to see if removing sticky expanded rows resolves jat-1xa13.
suggestedTasks.reason: User mentioned sticky headers may be causing jat-1xa13 clipping issues

patterns: Use :global() selector to override child component styles from parent page CSS
gotchas: Sticky positioning in nested containers requires careful z-index and top offset calculations
